description: Full day exploring Fukuoka - shrine hopping tour of three historic shrines

activities.name: Sumiyoshi Shrine
activities.description: One of Japan's three most important Sumiyoshi shrines, featuring traditional architecture and peaceful grounds. This ancient Shinto shrine is dedicated to the three Sumiyoshi gods of the sea.

activities.name: Route to Tooka Ebisu Shrine
activities.description: Travel from Sumiyoshi Shrine to Tooka Ebisu Shrine (approx. 30 minutes)

activities.name: Tooka Ebisu Shrine
activities.description: Dedicated to Ebisu, the god of prosperity and good fortune in business. Popular with merchants and business people, especially during the annual Toka Ebisu festival.

activities.name: Lunch break
activities.description: Enjoy local Fukuoka specialties near the shrine area

activities.name: Route to Jurokuten Shrine
activities.description: Travel from central Fukuoka to Jurokuten Shrine (approx. 45 minutes)

activities.name: Jurokuten Shrine
activities.description: A historic shrine dedicated to the sixteen protective deities. Known for its serene atmosphere and beautiful traditional architecture nestled in a peaceful setting.

activities.name: Return to Hakata area
activities.description: Return to central Hakata area for evening activities

activities.name: Hakata Bay area exploration
activities.description: Explore the modern Hakata Bay area with its waterfront views, shopping, and urban atmosphere as a contrast to the traditional shrines visited earlier.

reservations.name: Hakata Base The Passage 2号
reservations.description: Private accommodation in Hakata Ward, Fukuoka hosted by Naoki - second night of stay for Fukuoka exploration

meals: Lunch: Local Fukuoka specialties, Dinner: Hakata ramen and yatai food stalls
notes: Fukuoka's shrine tour showcases the city's spiritual heritage. Sumiyoshi is one of Japan's most important Sumiyoshi shrines, while Tooka Ebisu attracts business prosperity seekers. Complete the day with Hakata's famous street food scene.
